intro: Chenopodium album var. klinggraeffii, commonly known as prickly goosefoot, is a variant of the common lambsquarters, characterized by its spiny leaves and stems. It is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and agricultural fields. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that develop into hard, spherical seeds. Its leaves are typically oval with a rough texture and may have a bluish or purplish hue. It is known for its adaptability to various environmental conditions and is often considered a weed in cultivated areas.
